featured.text: Therefore, using the plant as a fuel source will not put pressure on food prices.
It came with a high price tag and tea was taxed as well.
Some coins may command higher prices because they are more popular with collectors.

other.text: The situation worsened when the industrial production of vodka began in the country, causing its prices to drop sharply and making it available to even low-income citizens.
I did NOT like the price, though.
The rise of oil prices made scientists search for new energy resources to ______ oil.

Admission for guests with special needs is free, and fees for the general public are set at a much discounted price so that people of all ages and abilities can come together and play in a fun and safe environment.
Due to _______, prices for daily necessities have gone up and we have to pay more for the same items now.
With rising oil prices, there is an increasing _____ for people to ride bicycles to work.
“The prices have come down and the quality has gone up.

definition.zh_def: 價格，商品或服務的貨幣價值。
definition.en_def: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
definition.example: The price of the book is twenty dollars.
